docs.lead_paragraph: MAHONY--Robert C., age 92, of Bronxville, NY, formerly of Riverdale, NY, died Saturday, November 12, 2011 in his home. Husband to Doris Sullivan and father to Barbara Weaver, Robert J. Mahony, Michael P. Mahony, Maureen Casper, and Mary Jo Flynn, he was most proud of the 42 children, grandchildren and great-grandchildren that he took direct responsibility for producing. An active parishioner of St Joseph's Catholic Church in Bronxville for over 30 years (formerly of St. Margaret's in Riverdale for some 60 years), he taught CCD and was a lector and daily communicant. He was a Eucharistic Minister for his parish, visiting the sick at their homes and at Lawrence Hospital where he volunteered for many years. He took great joy in volunteering at the Pregnancy Care Center in New Rochelle where he walked and played with the children under their care. Robert ran the J.G. Mahony Company, Inc., insurance brokerage firm up until 2010, a firm his father established, and was on the Board of Directors of Anchor Savings Bank, Dime Savings Bank, and The Schervier Nursing Care Center in the Bronx, NY. He is survived by his brother, Richard Mahony, and sister, Catherine Howett. Calling Hours at the Fred H. McGrath & Son Funeral Home, Bronxville between the hours of 4-7pm Sunday and 2-4 and 7-9pm Monday. Mass of Christian Burial St. Joseph's Church, Bronxville on Tuesday, November 15 at 10am.

docs.lead_paragraph: Subject: Erin Judge, 30, a writer in New York. Previous ''Twilight'' exposure: A friend once discussed ''the pregnancy scene'' with Judge because she needed to get it off her chest. Name the four ''Twilight'' books. Something about an apple? The titles are mostly about fruit. One is called ''Breaking Dawn,'' I think, but I could be conflating zombie television. What do you mean? Like, am I mixing up ''Breaking Bad'' or ''Walking Dawn''? Or ''Walking Dead''? You know, to make ''Breaking Dawn''? [Correct answer: ''Twilight,'' ''New Moon,'' ''Eclipse,'' ''Breaking Dawn.''] You might be. Who plays Edward Cullen? Oh! It's that pale kid. Possibly -- is his name Justin? [Correct answer: Robert Pattinson.] Why is Alice in a mental institution? Something about her being pregnant with a vampire baby. [Correct answer: She was having visions of the future.] What are the people in the diner thinking about when Edward reads their minds? How pale he is. [Correct answer: Money, sex and, in one case, a cat.] Who is Jacob? Jacob is a sexy werewolf! [Correct answer: Sexy werewolf.] Everyone knows that one. Yeah! Because of the whole Team Edward vs. Team Jacob thing. Also, Jacob reminds me of Anthony Kiedis in the ''Under the Bridge'' video. Why don't the Cullens eat people? Maybe a person was nice to them once and so they're mainstreamers, like in ''True Blood'' or ''Buffy''? Wait, is Edward's last name Cohen? [Correct answer: They're ''vegetarian'' vampires. They eat animals instead.] Cohen? No. Cullen. With an ''l.' 'Oh, I was going to say maybe it's not kosher. What happens to Twilight vampires in the sun? They're very shiny? They look like marble, like the Lincoln memorial. [Correct answer: They sparkle.] What human sport do vampires play? Lacrosse. Because they're European. [Correct answer: Baseball.] Team Edward or Team Jacob and why? Team Jacob because all of Edward's weird, sappy, sad, virginy, purity, shiny crap is crap. My pro-Jacob stance is at heart an anti-Edward stance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The results of a study of “e-cigarettes” are encouraging, but a coalition of government officials and antismoking groups are warning about their dangers and trying to ban their sale.

headline.seo: E-Cigarettes Help Smokers Quit, but They Have Some Unlikely Critics
headline.main: A Tool to Quit Smoking Has Some Unlikely Critics
headline.print_headline: A Tool to Quit Smoking Has Some Unlikely Critics

docs.abstract: Study finds electronic cigarettes can help reduce and even eliminate cigarette consumption in smokers, but several organizations in United States want them banned; prohibitionists, many of them liberals, note e-cigarettes have not undergone vigorous safety studies and say they may be gateway to smoking for young people.
docs.snippet: The results of a study of “e-cigarettes” are encouraging, but a coalition of government officials and antismoking groups are warning about their dangers and trying to ban their sale.
